 void giveMeCoverageForMyPrivateConstructor()
          Easy win to get coverage and eliminate noise in the report: putting the idealism aside the following test does the job.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForEmptyList()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for empty list.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForMultipleEmptyElements()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for empty elements.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForNull()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for null parameter.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForSimpleEmptyList()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for one empty element.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForSimpleList()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for one empty and one occupied element.
 void testGetFreeGridCellsForSimpleOccupiedList()
          Testing SMUtils.getFreeGridCells(List) for occupied elements.
 void testGridQuery()
          Test if grid is set it is returned by the agent.
 void testNoGrid()
          Test failure if there is no grid associated to this agent.
 void testProbAlwaysFalse()
          Assert that a threshold level of one always return false.
 void testProbAlwaysTrue()
          Assert that a threshold level of zero always return true.
 void testProbNegativeValue()
          Test if SMUtils.prob(double) fails for negative parameters.
 void testProbParamAboveOne()
          Test if SMUtils.prob(double) fails for threshold parameters above one.
 void testRandomElementOfContainsResult()
          Testing SMUtils.randomElementOf(List) for a sample list.
 void testRandomElementOfDoesNotModifiesOriginalList()
          Assert that SMUtils.randomElementOf(List) does not modify the original list.
 void testRandomElementOfForEmptyList()
          Testing SMUtils.randomElementOf(List) for empty list.
 void testRandomElementOfForNull()
          Testing SMUtils.randomElementOf(List) for null parameter.
 void testRandomElementOfForSingletonList()
          Testing SMUtils.randomElementOf(List) for a singleton list.
 void testReadDataFileWithEmptyParameter()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails for empty file name.
 void testReadDataFileWithInvalidData()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails when the specified input file has invalid data (here we have a string instead of a number in one of the lines).
 void testReadDataFileWithLockedFile()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails when opening can be done but reading fails due to some reason (here we create a lock on the file with java.nio).
 void testReadDataFileWithMissingData()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails when the specified input file is missing data (here there is only x and y coordinates in one of the lines).
 void testReadDataFileWithNoTarget()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails for some nonexistent file.
 void testReadDataFileWithNullParameter()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) fails for null argument.
 void testReadDataFileWithSampleData()
          Test SMUtils.readDataFile(String) when we have a well-formed sample data.
